[{"id":"34bea6ab-d4dd-4b7f-9872-e2f234e0e44e","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraphGenerator","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"36164c0b-06fd-463f-b013-f49af545012c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraphGenerator","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class is the central orchestrator of the Jarvis framework. It acts as the "Controller" in a Model-View-Controller architecture, bringing together the static structural data (models) and the analysis engines (logic) to produce a cohesive call graph. By managing the lifecycle of an analysis run, it ensures that cross-module dependencies, class hierarchies, and data-flow points are synchronized and accurately reflected in the final output.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"458aad3c-4609-443d-aa41-ecadf5bcae83","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"1a91dab1-79ad-4013-8ed3-887ad1d59413","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Logic Groups","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"03a3882f-74ab-48f0-9de7-79a7bf43a52b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Initialization and Environment Setup
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods prepare the Jarvis engine for a new scan. This includes instantiating the suite of "Machinery" managers (Import, Scope, Definition, Class, etc.) and initializing the global state utility. It also handles the normalization of module paths to ensure consistent namespace naming across different operating systems.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"33062317-4867-4a3f-b4e4-e45a1e870df9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Methods","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"setUp","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_get_mod_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"reset_counters","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"remove_import_hooks","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"62e102b7-34b8-4df3-9118-c2ae0192676c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Analysis Execution and Control Flow
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"This group contains the high-level logic that drives the analysis. It coordinates "passes" over the source code, moving from specified entry points into the deeper logic of the application. It is responsible for installing Python import hooks to track dynamic dependencies and invoking the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to perform the actual AST traversal.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2822811e-f0d4-4e39-9110-930360727936","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Methods","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"do_pass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"00340ec4-20e6-442d-b8db-7ba93bac87af","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Results Access and Output Interfaces
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Once the analysis is complete, these methods provide the interface for extracting findings. They transform complex internal manager objects into simplified dictionaries or graphs suitable for JSON serialization, visualization, or external audit reports.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"88fc632a-016c-495e-a7ff-9cf93016d692","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Methods","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_edges","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_functions","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_classes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_internal_mods","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_external_mods","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"extract_state","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_as_graph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cc341bde-817b-4fe8-9c78-2a0e93cc206f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"a604a823-cf02-4113-8ed8-84392793ec41","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c64ea650-53d7-4b2e-a918-bb9decd4d331","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraphGenerator","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the main object used by developers or CLI tools to interact with the engine.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cdc7d70b-c350-4713-968f-97063fca8ffb","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"import jarvis

# 1. Initialize with target files and the package root
# 'precision=True' enables line-by-line flow-sensitive analysis
cg_gen = jarvis.CallGraphGenerator(
    entry_points=["app/main.py"],
    package="/home/user/my_project",
    precision=True
)

# 2. Trigger the analysis lifecycle
cg_gen.analyze()

# 3. Retrieve the high-level call graph edges
edges = cg_gen.output_edges()
for caller, callee in edges:
    print(f"{caller} -> {callee}")

# 4. Export the class MROs for inheritance analysis
classes = cg_gen.output_classes()","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9acec712-ce62-44bf-b8fd-a8a72eb23ac9","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1d86e579-ae9d-4384-87e1-8ae47b6055a2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Manager Orchestration","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"setUp","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method is the only place where the entire "Machinery" of Jarvis is assembled. This design ensures that every subsystem (like the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"DefinitionManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") has a consistent, unified view of the project state.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"756df26f-a518-4fd1-864a-5a48e75dabcf","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hook Lifecycle","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The management of import hooks (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"remove_import_hooks","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") is critical for performance and safety; it ensures the analyzer doesn't permanently pollute the Python runtime environment while tracking project-specific imports.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"21c6584b-dc37-4d9e-abe9-7ec8c561eb94","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Precision Control","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By setting the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"precision","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" flag, the generator communicates directly with the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"machinery.gol","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (Global Object List), which in turn alters the behavior of data modeling classes deep within the engine.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"696c27a6-9048-4418-9ed5-d1f56a28168d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
